SENT.plain: We report a 36-year-old man who admitted due to brain infarctions of the pons and cerebellum
He had a history of brain infarction 4 years ago
Chest radiograph and enhanced CT showed an abnormal shadow in the superior mediastinum
Chest enhanced CT showed dilated right and persistent left superior vena cava (PLSVC), and venous thrombus was detected in the thorax
The PLSVC connected directly to the left atrium
Abdominal CT showed surface irregularity of the bilateral kidney, suggesting that renal infarctions had occurred
There was no risk factor of systemic embolism except for PLSVC thrombosis

We thought that retention of blood flow caused the formation of thrombus in the PLSVC, and the thrombus flowed into directly the systemic circulation through the left atrium and caused multiple embolisms
